INTERNSHIPS
01 May, 2025  - 01 Jul, 2025 PlaceMantra  | Core Engineering
Key Skills: XAMPP Technical Documentation Cloud Computing LAMP AWS
Migrated a local educational web application(Attendance Management System) to AWS Cloud by configuring and deploying backend
services on EC2 and securely managing user data using an S3 Bucket. Implemented IAM roles and policies to provide fine-grained
access control for admin and class-teacher accounts, ensuring security and role-based permissions for cloud operations.
PROJECTS
15 Jan, 2025  -  25 May, 2025RIce Leaf Disease Prediction
Team Size: 2
Key Skills: Machine Learning Image Processing Android Development Android Studio Docker
Project Link:  https://github.com/PrathamS009/Rice-Leaf-Disease-Prediction
This project was about identifying diseases in rice leaves using deep learning. The idea was to help farmers or anyone in agriculture
detect diseases early just by uploading a picture of the leaf.
I worked on two models – one was a CNN built from scratch, and the other used MobileNetV2 with transfer learning. Both were trained
on a dataset of rice leaf images (healthy + different diseases). After training and testing, I deployed the model using Streamlit so users
could try it out through a simple web app.
I Dockerized the whole project and created an Android app for mobile predictions. The entire process—from preprocessing images,
building and training the model, evaluating performance, to deployment—was done by me and my teammate Ria.
It really helped me apply everything I’ve been learning in machine learning, especially in computer vision, and also gave me hands-on
experience with deployment tools like Streamlit and Docker.
10 Jul, 2024  -  20 Dec, 2024Women Safety Analytics
Team Size: 2
Key Skills: Machine Learning Image Processing Deep Learning CCTV
This was a passion project I built to address women’s safety using technology. The idea was to create a system that could analyze
CCTV footage in real time and detect potential threats. I implemented gender classification and SOS gesture recognition using
computer vision and AI models.
Using Python and OpenCV, I worked on detecting people, tracking them, and identifying if someone was showing signs of distress (like
a specific SOS hand gesture). I also integrated live camera feeds and designed the logic for real-time alerts. The goal was to build a
smart system that could help in public safety and be integrated with surveillance infrastructure in places like streets, buses, or
campuses.

Gender: Male

This project really helped me strengthen my skills in computer vision, deep learning, and real-time data processing. It’s one of the most
meaningful projects I’ve worked on because of its potential to make an actual impact.
10 Jan, 2024  -  20 May, 2024Pet Adoption Platform
Team Size: 2
Key Skills: Java NetBeans GUI JDBC
Built a partially functional app to connect users with animals from local shelters, promoting adoption.
Facilitated user interaction by allowing browsing and selection of available pets, bridging the gap between animal shelters and potential
adopters.
